title: Designer Of Pro-Trump Grammy Gown Is A Naturalized Filipino Immigrant
text:
Designer Of Pro-Trump Grammy Gown Is A Naturalized Filipino Immigrant "I really love this country." by Andrew Kerr February 13, 2017 at 12:55pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Singer Joy Villa’s “Make America Great Again” dress, which rocked the Grammys Sunday night, was designed by none other than Andre Soriano, a gay immigrant from the Philippines. 
Soriano said he aimed to send a message of positivity and love with the gown, calling it “a tribute to OUR President of the United States.” 
“It’s more so about love,” the designer told The Hollywood Reporter. Advertisement - story continues below Instead of Trump Bashing, Recording Academy President Asks For Trump’s Help 
“I am an American, I moved here from the Philippines, and I highly believed in the trueness of what this country can bring. It’s about bringing people together, that’s the message,” he continued. A photo posted by Andre Soriano (@officialandresoriano) on Feb 12, 2017 at 2:41pm PST 
“There are a lot of people that are in power that really misconstrued what this country stands for,” Soriano said when asked about his political beliefs. Advertisement - story continues below 
“I love this country. I’m from the Philippine islands. I am a proud American. I really love this country. I am a minority. Joy is black. America is about immigrants.” 
Soriano, who is a naturalized American citizen, rose to fame on Rihanna’s Bravo reality show, Styled to Rock , and launched his own online-only label in 2013. 
The designer has outfitted a number of stars for red-carpet events, including singers Macy Gray and Courtney Love and actress Bai Ling. 
But Soriano said he has a special place in his heart for Villa. Advertisement - story continues below
